trans-unit.source: Register for Facebook authentication | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Register for Facebook authentication | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Facebook authentication in your Azure Mobile Services app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Facebook authentication in your Azure Mobile Services app.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to register your apps to be able to use Facebook to authenticate with Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to register your apps to be able to use Facebook to authenticate with Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is about [Azure Mobile Services], a solution to help you build scalable mobile applications for any platform.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is about [Azure Mobile Services], a solution to help you build scalable mobile applications for any platform.

trans-unit.source: Mobile Services makes it easy to sync data, authenticate users, and send push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Mobile Services makes it easy to sync data, authenticate users, and send push notifications.

trans-unit.source: This page supports the Get Started with Authentication tutorial which shows how to log users into your app.
trans-unit.target: This page supports the Get Started with Authentication tutorial which shows how to log users into your app.

trans-unit.source: If this is your first experience with Mobile Services, please complete the tutorial Get Started with Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: If this is your first experience with Mobile Services, please complete the tutorial Get Started with Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: To complete the procedure in this topic, you must have a Facebook account that has a verified email address and a mobile phone number.
trans-unit.target: To complete the procedure in this topic, you must have a Facebook account that has a verified email address and a mobile phone number.

trans-unit.source: To create a new Facebook account, go to facebook.com.
trans-unit.target: To create a new Facebook account, go to facebook.com.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Facebook Developers website and sign-in with your Facebook account credentials.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Facebook Developers website and sign-in with your Facebook account credentials.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) If you have not already registered, click My Apps then click Register as a Developer, accept the policy and follow the registration steps.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) If you have not already registered, click My Apps then click Register as a Developer, accept the policy and follow the registration steps.

trans-unit.source: Click My Apps > Add a New App > Advanced setup.
trans-unit.target: Click My Apps > Add a New App > Advanced setup.

trans-unit.source: Type a unique Display name for your app, choose Apps for Pages under Category, then click Create App ID and complete the security exercise.
trans-unit.target: Type a unique Display name for your app, choose Apps for Pages under Category, then click Create App ID and complete the security exercise.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new Facebook app ID.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new Facebook app ID.

trans-unit.source: Click Settings, type the domain of your mobile service in App Domains, enter an optional Contact Email, click Add Platform and select Website.
trans-unit.target: Click Settings, type the domain of your mobile service in App Domains, enter an optional Contact Email, click Add Platform and select Website.

trans-unit.source: Type the URL of your mobile service in Site URL, then click Save Changes.
trans-unit.target: Type the URL of your mobile service in Site URL, then click Save Changes.

trans-unit.source: Click Show, provide your password if requested, then make a note of the values of App ID and App Secret.
trans-unit.target: Click Show, provide your password if requested, then make a note of the values of App ID and App Secret.

trans-unit.source: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: The app secret is an important security credential.
trans-unit.target: The app secret is an important security credential.

trans-unit.source: Do not share this secret with anyone or distribute it with your app.
trans-unit.target: Do not share this secret with anyone or distribute it with your app.

trans-unit.source: Click the Advanced tab, type the URL of your mobile service appended with the path /login/facebook in Valid OAuth redirect URIs, then click Save Changes.
trans-unit.target: Click the Advanced tab, type the URL of your mobile service appended with the path /login/facebook in Valid OAuth redirect URIs, then click Save Changes.

trans-unit.source: For a .NET backend mobile service published to Azure by using Visual Studio, the redirect URL is the URL of your mobile service appended with the path signin-facebook your mobile service as a .NET service, such as https://todolist.azure-mobile.net/signin-facebook.
trans-unit.target: For a .NET backend mobile service published to Azure by using Visual Studio, the redirect URL is the URL of your mobile service appended with the path signin-facebook your mobile service as a .NET service, such as https://todolist.azure-mobile.net/signin-facebook.

trans-unit.source: Click Status & Review > Yes to enable general public access to your app.
trans-unit.target: Click Status & Review > Yes to enable general public access to your app.

trans-unit.source: The Facebook account you used to register the new app is an administrator of the app and has access to the app as administrator.
trans-unit.target: The Facebook account you used to register the new app is an administrator of the app and has access to the app as administrator.

trans-unit.source: This step grants the general public access so that the app can authenticate by using other Facebook accounts.
trans-unit.target: This step grants the general public access so that the app can authenticate by using other Facebook accounts.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to use a Facebook login for authentication in your app by providing the App ID and App Secret values to Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to use a Facebook login for authentication in your app by providing the App ID and App Secret values to Mobile Services.
